Ohohohohohoho..... I'm still in stitches.
Ever since my first review of Meganebu!, I've been looking to try out another one. Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru, or NouCome, is one that I've been the most inclined to write about after finishing it. Downright hilarious, with vivid colouring, lovable characters, and a sense of immense euphoria when you watch, I recommend NouCome as your next anime to watch. And here's why!
*Epic fanfare of credible facts/popular opinions (Not sure what that'd sound like, honestly)*
STORY - 6/10
Story goes like this: A high-school boy, Kanade Amakusa, is suffering from a psychological torture hedubs "Absolute Choice", where an entity enters his head and forces him to make a choice between two things; failure to comply would result in migraine-level head pains until he made the choice. The sad (and gut-busting) thing, though, is that these choices that he makes are usually disgusting, perverted, and generally weird, causing his popularity to go down drastically, until he becomes a part of the Reject Five of his high school. And so, Kanade, along with his friends (of a mainly female cast), set out on a ten-episode joyride of hilarity to cure his Absolute Choice ailment.


Now... NouCome technically has no plot. It's like... nonexistent. Zip. Nada. Nicht. Zilch. *However*... the creators of NouCome utilise this lack of plot to constantly dish its viewers a huge dose of comedy and laughs, and that's good, because like with some animes like Eyeshield 21 or Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita, you wouldn't just watch an anime for just primarily the plot: you'd watch it for the conflict, the tension, the suspense, the romance (if any), and the lulz. That's what you oughta do for NouCome if you want to get more of a kick out of it. Otherwise, you'll get a bit bored with it.


ART - 8/10


The art of NouCome is very pretty. It's nice, it's lush, the animations is smooth and fluid, and the character designers don't have to actually draw their characters in chibi form or in a simplistic manner to indicate moments of comedy like in a lot of animes (e.g.:Nichijou, Lucky Star, Working!!, etc.) While not absolutely god-tier, it's still a sight for sore eyes after a long day.


SOUND - 7/10 


 NouCome has a nice little array of music and sound effects. Their catchy opening theme by Afilia Saga, along with their ending theme by TWO-FORMULA (produced by Saeko Zougou and Chocolat's voice actor Kaori Sadohara), accompany this anime well like cream cheese on a bagel. The BGM is appropriate for whatever moments in the anime occur, and the sound effects are well executed.


CHARACTER - 10/10 (Wowzers!)


Oh, man....


It was hard to pick favourite characters from this anime, because I just liked them all. Heck, even the background characters get some love from me b/c of the hilarious stuff they say when Kanade gets all weird due to Absolute Choice.


But, I'll list some. You've got Kanade Amakusa, the male protagonist with Absolute Choice on the brain; Yuuouji Ouka, a dear friend of Kanade, an eccentric and overall happy girl, and the daughter of UOG company's president; Furano Yukihira, a girl with a weird sense of humour and who loves to verbally abuse Kanade; There's Chocolat, the girl who fell from the heavens upon one fateful Absolute Choice, and will eat anything and everything of confectionery tastes as she resides with Kanade as his "pet" (Yep, she's like a bishoujo form of Gluttony from FMA); Yuragi Hakoniwa, the "imouto" of pretty much every single character in NouCome because she feels like it. There's also the Charagami (Flippant God) who calls Kanade and gives him his missions to get rid of Absolute Choice, Kanade's teacher who looks like a kid, has experienced Absolute Choice and cured herself of it; the Popular Five of the school; and so many more.


I could go on, and on, and on.... But I won't. You should experience it for yourselves, after all.


ENJOYMENT - 10/10 (Another one?!)


This anime is really enjoyable. I kid you not. Right next to Kuroshitsuji, Toradora!, Nichijou, and several others I can list, NouCome has reserved a special place in my little heart of ice. The romantic comedy that it constantly smacks you around with is *REALLY* difficult to take with a straight face. By the third episode (if not the first or second), you WILL be laughing as hard as I did.


OVERALL - 10/10 (Triple whammy, baby!)


Pound for pound, I absolutely adored NouCome. The funny array of characters, the neat looking art style, the lack of a plot being exploited for absolute hilarity, and even the attempts at romance that end up in a trainwreck of lulz; all of it. I was so pleased to watch this, and I think you will be, too, folks.


So... choose.


[ ] - Watch Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru (NouCome)

[ ] - Do not watch Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru (NouCome)

NOTE: My review is a short one that will give you a glimpse into what the anime is about and will not take much of your time to read ^^
What if random choices pop up into your mind which are ridiculous and will make you an outcast in the society? What if they are enough to ruin your social image? Will you choose any of the choices? Most probably a no but then you don't have an option of not making a choice if you don't make a choice your head hurts as in it's going to burst at any moment now.
This story is abouta boy Amakusa Kanade who is suffering from these random pop ups at the worst time possible. He is now called the member of the reject five(the five that are acknowledged by none) because of these choices which he has named the absolute choices. One random moment he chooses that a girl falls from the sky and she actually does and the tedious life of Kanade begins to get rid of the absolute choices. What must he do to get rid of them? I won't tell you that as it may act as a spoiler for many. But his struggle to get rid of them brings laughter to us, what more do we want.\n
Now lets look into the art. The art is quite good 8/10 for me. Also for the male watchers we have lots and lots of oppai. \n
The jokes in the anime are quite funny and will make you laugh hearts out.\n
I would recommend it to all if you wish to laugh. Noucome is quite a refreshing anime but with only one sad point, the end is a cliffhanger. \n
8/10 for me and one of the best ones for fall winter 2013.\n

Erabe:
1. Give this anime a shot.
2. Watch Mars of Destruction.
3. Something!
(Warning: choice 3 is potentially catastrophic)
Don't like these choices? Be glad you're not the protagonist of this series. This guy is a literal wreck from all the mishaps that go on throughout this anime (you can see it in the way he grins all the time). Noucome has one heck of a premise to build on, and it certainly knows how to make great use of it. This is an anime that does not know how to hold back; it takes everything you'd normally see in a stereotypical, rom-com anime and blows it far outof proportion. And not only will it do so with these seemingly generic concepts, but it'll even have a few unique ideas for comedy present as well. The way this anime is written truly does surprise the heck out of me at times.\n\n
Enough of all that, I bet you want to know more about the plot, right? Well, while it definitely isn't this anime's strong point, it is there. And it may not be anything worthwhile, either, but the plot is enough to compliment the series of events in a way that they don't go anywhere without any real direction. This anime does have a clear and concise goal (believe it or not). And, on the plus side, it's written in a way that compliments the overall feel of the series; it's zany, whimsical, and outrageous. Also, surprisingly enough, the writing does put this seemingly bleak moe series a cut above the rest as it adds a certain degree of uniqueness to the setting and romance. The only major drawback I've found with the storyline was the lack of completeness. At least I was expecting that much after episode six and wasn't really let down by it. I mean, really, what more can you expect from this kind of storyline in ten episodes? At the very least, however, NouCome actually doesn't waste any time with pointless antics and scenarios. So it's ten episodes well spent.\n\n
The designs in this series may not be anything groundbreaking, but they're still pretty fantastic. It was the very character designs themselves that actually pulled me in to watch (risky, I know, but I couldn't help it). I'm glad that this anime did not lose its artistic luster over time at least. There have been many series of this kind in the past where drops in quality were blatantly noticeable, but not so much with this one. There probably are a few scenes that could have looked better, but I'm not picky enough to actually notice them unless they're obvious. And there are some sceneries that look genuinely nice too, and the light-colored designs are a pretty hard standard for rom-com anime. It's almost too much of a blessing to me to see these kind of designs as I am generally a fan of it.\n\n
Out of all the fun characters in this cast, Yukihira Furano is unabatedly the best addition to this series. Sure, you can say what you want about the quirkiness of the others, but Yukihira is essentially the greatest focus in terms of development. And while she may not have developed to a favorable degree (I blame the length), she does have a solid enough change to where I could actually grow attached to her characters and will forever hold her close to my heart. There's a certain other side to Yukihara that I just can't help but love. Between her keen insults, her unusual antics, and her social inadequacies, she certainly does have some peculiar characteristics. God, I really do wish I had more to say about her, it's a shame this series couldn't be longer. Hopefully another season will add a little more depth to her character. As for everyone else (I guess I'll get to them too), they are not too bad either. Can never go wrong with loli teachers (they're one of the many wonders in anime), excessive imouto characters, large booby girls with an ego, etc. They're all exceedingly quirky, and fun. Nothing quite out of the ordinary with the protagonist, but he has his moments at least. In many ways, I feel really sorry for him.\n\n
As with many other comedies, this anime will only hit home with certain audiences. The first couple episodes will be a good measure of what you can expect from the rest of this series. If the comedy in the first couple episodes doesn't fit your preferences, you're not likely to change your mind later on. Personally, I loved every episode as much as the last one. It may seem like the anime makes a slight decline in the 2nd half, but I didn't think that in the slightest. It just take a different approach to its comedy that may or may not be agreeable, but it's not bad at all. There are some elements of fanservice, but they come off as more of a parody/comedy device rather than a pandering one. That aside, if generic harem and rom-com series are something you take a liking too, this anime will not bore you at all. And even if you're not, this may be a pleasant surprise. The only viewers I can see not liking this anime are the hardcore serious types, or those that are overly bothered by rom-com stereotypes. Good thing I'm a really casual viewer, this series is a true blessing to those that don't take anime seriously!\n\n
Personal Score: 7/10\n
Critic Score: 5/10

When you think of Japanese humour (or at least this is what I think of when I think of Japanese humour), it normally boils down to being over the top and ridiculous and every way possible, which is the only way I can properly describe Noucome in a single sitting.
The best part of Noucome is undoubtedly it's comedy. It's formula for laughs is incredibly simple: have the main character be forced into situations where he has to choose between two or three different choices given to him by some deeply-voiced unknown guy. The actual comedy stems from two things mainly: the absurdity of the choicesand the absurdity of the characters. I can barely think of a joke that missed it's mark in this anime because they were so damn funny.


There is one particular thing to note about Noucome, and that is it's length. The length of this anime is a measly 10 episodes, which is both a good and a bad thing. On a positive note, since the anime is so short, the jokes don't overstay their welcome, so you can make sure that you can laugh from beginning to end no problem without feeling any sort of repetitivity. However, many of the elements of the story and characters don't get explored much at all because of time constraints, making the anime feel extremely rushed. There was so much more that needed to be completed to get a full sense of closure, and it just didn't come to fruition. I mean, you get introduced to a character like Karasu Yumeshima, who seems incredibly interesting and crazy and could add a lot to the comedy, but he is barely in the anime for 5 minutes, which is ridiculous to me.


One last major negative point I had with this series was the drama. Whenever a dramatic moment popped up, it totally ruined the fun atmosphere that the comedy provides. Thankfully, these moments were few and far between, but the addition of this poorly written drama was unnecessary and straight up jarring.


The characters here are something you don't see all the time, which is a good thing is this case. Basically, they are all nutheads with ridiculous personality traits and quirks that add to the comedy as much as Absolute Choice does. I do wish that they were more fleshed out than they were, but that doesn't really matter in the long run as this is a comedy anime, and as long as they make me laugh, that is all that matters. I still wish that some of them had more screen time though.


 I won't go into detail for any of them except the main character as it is better to just experience them for yourself. Even then, the only thing I will say about the main character is he is the only thing in this show that really has good character growth and a good character conclusion. Although he wants to get rid of his Absolute Choice, he doesn't want to do it in a way that isn't true to himself and/or hurts his friends. And while that is cheesy as fuck, it's a nice way to round out his character and is a nice little message to send out to the viewer.


As for animation, let me start off by saying that there is A TON of fanservice. The fanservice did actually add to a lot of the comedic moments in Noucome, so I don't have any problems with it in this case. The animation and art itself was solid. Nothing was particularly groundbreaking about it, and nothing was gutwrenchingly horrible about it either. It was good, and that's all it needed to be.


The soundtrack here is not memorable at all, so there isn't much to talk about there. The opening theme served a little better, as it is catchy and matched the fun and crazy feel of the anime well. The best part of the sound by far was the voice acting. Everybody did a top notch job here, but my standout performance was easily Furano Yukihira played by Yui Kondou. She needs some more roles, because played both sides of Furano's character extremely well.


Noucome is one of the best comedy anime I have seen in a while. Even though the whole thing felt extremely rushed and the drama just did not work, it made me laugh on numerous occasions, and if a comedy anime can do that, that it receives a recommendation from me. If you like the over the top craziness that Japan seems to be known for, then definitely check this show out. If you just want a laugh, this show will still do you just fine, even though there will be parts here and there that might irk you as it irked me.

Life is full of choices and the choices that we make can really make a big difference in our lives. This is true in "Noucome". 
Fall 2013 or known as "Post-(Shingeki no Kyojin) season" surely is a good season for me to watch anime. In fact, one of the anime I watch is "Noucome". "Noucome" is a light novel adaptation directed by Takayuki Inagaki and produced by Diomedea. 
STORY (7):
The story follows Kanade Amakusa who suffers from "Absolute Choice". He has to choose which route he wants to take otherwise he will suffer a bad headache. Kanade gets to know the "Reject 5" who haveodd personalities that people do not like about them. After that, Kanade gets thrown into crazy shinanigans.


The dialogues were funny but it was not so funny to the point whereby I laughed till I am out of breath. Though it is good to have fun rather than taking this anime too seriously. For instance, Kanade says "Please touch my boobs". I never saw that coming.


ART (8):


The art looks spectacular and most of the female character designs are cute.


SOUND (8):


The opening theme SML was very fantastic. It had me dancing and shaking. The ending theme "Taiyo no Tsuki Cross" was alright. The voice actors did a good job in portraying the voices of each characters. Most of them sounded cute.


CHARACTER (7):


To be honest, I really don't have a favorite character. I just like all of them. At least they never show me bad attitudes. 


Furano Yukihara can sometimes change her personality which also results in a change of tone in her voice.


Yuragi hakoniwa, in her yandere mode in episode 7 was the best, she was like a ghost when she is in her yandere mode.


Now let's talk about Kanade, the protagonist. He is the most unlucky one out of the whole cast. He has to complete his mission so that "Absolute Choice" curse can be removed. In doing so, he gets bullied by his classmates. For example, one scene when Kanade is having a conversation in Konagi, suddenly Kanade starts to have a choice of being perverted towards Konagi. This results in, Kanade being picked on by Konagi's men.


Konagi Kawakaze is a shy girl who requires protection from her men.


Seira Kokubyakuin is calm and composed. When she hugs Kanade in episode 7, it was the best part. 


There is really not much to talk about for the rest of the cast.


CONCLUSION (7):


Sadly, this anime is only 10 episodes long and we want to have a better understanding of the characters. But what I rate is based on how worthwhile it is to watch the 10 episodes of Noucome.


The finale, when snow starts to fall on the beach and "Silent Night" music is played, lightens up the mood for Christmas as you can tell we are in the Christmas season but Christmas day is coming soon. The anime ends in a snowball war which is fun and thrilling.


It is really sad that we never get to see the Flippant God who is in charge of Kanade's "Absolute Choices".


Although there is really nothing interesting to talk about in this anime, it is really a fun ride. If you are into slice-of-life comedy, I would recommend this anime. You probably might find something you might like in this anime. You probably might find something funny to watch in this anime. So I give it a 7. 


This anime also brings a lot of lessons to learn from it.


Choose:

1: Enjoy it.

2: Hate it.

3: Neutral


Stay tuned for more reviews to come.

Wow, that was a weird show!
This is just gonna be a quick little review.
Story (7/10): This is a comedy show, so obviously it doesn't have some amazing, super enthralling story. But it is an interesting concept and it gets the job done for setting up some pretty humorous situations.
Art (8/10): I personally thought the art looked very good. It fits the humor very well. It definitely didn't seem lazy and the backgrounds looked good. The coloring is also very fitting.
Sound (9/10): The OP is pretty good. It was pretty catchy. I liked the ED a lot, too. (Specifically the instrumentals.) I don't usually notice OSTsongs, but I noticed a few of them in this one and I thought they were pretty catchy. The OST was definitely very fitting. I also thought the voice acting was great.\n\n
Character (8/10): The characters aren't very deep or anything, but they are very humorous and funny. I found Furano to be pretty interesting, and the rest of the cast were also very likable and funny.\n\n
Enjoyment: (9/10) This show was freaking hilarious. It took some getting used to the humor, but once I did, I laughed a lot. I'm usually one to just smile at jokes more than audibly laugh, but this show made me laugh out loud numerous times an episode. It's a comedy show, and it did it's job well in this area.\n\n
Overall: (8.3/10) After watching the first couple episodes, I didn't think I would give this show above a 7/10. But I started to find it very funny and started to like the soundtrack a lot after watching a couple more episodes. If you are looking for a show that you can just sit back and watch to have a good laugh without needing an incredibly deep story, then this show is for you.

All girls like cute things and homos - Chocolat 
Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru, a good mix between romance and comedy but this is not your regular average harem anime. It has a good plot and idea to it, t delivers a genuinely refreshing experience that cleverly combines its moe appeal with a strong cast of characters. 
The story revolves around , Amakusa Kanade a teenage boy that has been cursed with absolute choices, Amakusa Kanade at random times cause a voice in his head to give him two or more choices to make. if hedecides to not do what is told in his head soon later he will get a severe headache making him choose one of the choices. he later meets Chocolat , a interesting girl that fell out of the sky and is here to help cure Amakusa Kanades curse.


Above all, this story is as imaginative and original as they come. Personally, I have never seen a story quite like this before, and because of that, it piqued my interest. however the only problem i have with the anime is that the ending is rushed and is poorly written.


The art in this series is generic anime style drawn to perfection. Unique design for the protagonist,The art never hinders your enjoyment of this anime and even improves the experiences. Overall i think the art is one of the stronger elements to this anime and it definitely shows.


The sound for this anime is somewhat generic I would say. It sounds really adorable, I will give it that, and the mood fillers for the anime do sound good and very appropriate for where they're placed. The OP and ED I would say are good but not overly fantastic


the characters in this anime are all made really well and all have their own unique characteristics that make them different. for example , all the females of this anime are all mad extremely different. there is Chocolat who is a overly energnic girl that always seems to have a good appetite. and then there is Furano Yukihira who  is also one of the main characters of the anime, but unlike Chocolat she is quiet but a little weird. She likes verbally abusing Kanade and has a weird sense of humor.


i would rate this anime a 8.5/10. I was never bored with the series, and enjoyed watching every moment. The comedy is pretty funny, I love the characters, and the story was plenty deep and interesting to keep me watching. but for the most part, I'm happy with what I watched. Overall this anime is something that made me laugh numerous times and is definitely worth watching. the only complaints i have on this anime is the fact that it is too rushed and should get another season to develop more

Noucome (AKA, Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru) is something I found out to be quite wonderful. But it does have its kinks. "Wait, wait, wait, if it's wonderful why do you have to go on and hate it, and say "it does have its kinks," HUH!?!"
My answer, well it's down below. 
Before I start off I just want to say that if you want a more in depth review for this anime, then please go on ahead and skip this read. I do also expect you to have SOME base knowledge about this before you read it,so I can "spoil" some of the more obvious stuff. 

For those of you who actually take the time to read this, thank you.


Story 7/10 (Let's dive right into it~)

The story is something I found out to be quite amusing, for I like to see people fail at life. I don't mean like, "oh wow you died, HAHAHAHAHA!!!" I just like seeing people act stupid, like the rest of you, don't lie to yourself, you do too. 

The story was refreshing simply because, as (hopefully) most of us are informed, life is full of choices, and in this anime the creators STRONGLY reinforce this, just in a funny manner. Everything in this that was "choice" based, is pretty much there to make you laugh. 

(Spoiler) From an abnormal school life, to coming home to a nice, lovely, sweet, cute, sexy neighbor (KEK); to then choosing that same neighbor, or a cute girl to fall from the sky... in just the first episode the story moves in a good pace. 

I just don't understand why there were multiple love interests in a 10 episode anime, I didn't like that, I mean there are really only 3 contestants, in this love thing, but still... Plus to me it just felt like having characters being introduced to mainly just support the leading characters felt unnecessary to me. Characters just "being there" is sort of a waste of time in my opinion. 

When the 3 love interests seem to have a moment with the MC, or vice versa, they completely build up the moment, but then end up just making it seem like, "well that just happened, but it's not what should have happened." Yeah one of those moments.

Overall, for this being a 10 episode series, it didn't seem TOOOOO rushed, except for maybe the ending, still quite an "OK" story. 


Art 7/10

I'm not usually to picky when it comes to the art aspect. Noucome had a more colorful palette, which fit this show quite well. The animation was pretty en-joyful, a lot of eye candy and fan service, I'm not the hugest fanboi of fan service, for that's what anime these days are turning towards, but I don't mind fan service. Overall, some pretty standard animation, nothing I haven't seen before, and lots of kawaii faces. 


Sound 7/10

For sound and music, I'm not too picky when it comes to this stuff either. Although what I do look for are a nice opening/openings and nice closing/closings, if the anime doesn't have these it's not a big deal. Although I honestly thought the opener and closer were mediocre, not too catchy, and they just didn't peak my interest. Although the sound tracks are quite good, the music fits the anime quite well. As for the voices, I thought they all were fit, and suited well. Some of the voices were a bit to high for my liking, but I could deal with it. All in all, pretty good.


Character 7.5/10

I think this is the part of the show that shines most. The characters aren't necessarily "different" when it comes to typing them and comparing them with other characters from other anime, you simply have the standard set of characters, that you would see in any anime like this. I don't want to say that these characters were the best, or just amazing, but they were pretty good. What I liked about this set of characters is that the main characters were all pretty different, and I mean they were all really different. Diversity does wonders when it comes to characters! 

I felt like the characters were a bit predictable, at times, almost to the point to where I probably could have guessed what happened, paused, skipped a little bit, and see if I was right. 

Again since this was only 10 episodes, I didn't expect too much character development to happen, but just enough development happened for me to sort of  feel satisfied. Overall, I was quite happy with the characters.


Enjoyment 9/10

I enjoyed almost, if not very close to all of this show. This show always had scenes that would make me laugh, and just make me smile and think what's going to happen next. Honestly I don't have much more to say other than, there are a lot of misunderstandings in this show, which amused me, and yet made me frustrated. Then I think, "why am I getting so worked up about this?" Because of a certain tsundere, that's why. I honestly hate her. 


Final Verdict 7/10    (7.5/10?!)

If I could rate this at a 7.4-7.6 I would. I just feel like giving it an 8 as an overall score is too high. And at the same time I also feel like giving it a 7 is just not doing it justice. The story and plot is amusing and funny, it can also be intriguing at times. And the characters play very well off of this story, I actually liked watching this.

I recommend this to people who want to watch something short, and funny. Something you don't have to invest much thought into afterwards. At the same time you have to be able to take dumb jokes and inappropriate/immature things like a man. Not a bad watch, not an OK watch, but a rather sort of good watch. 


~Anime and manga rot minds, just make sure to watch and read anyways.~

One of a kind. That is the word that defines this anime. Mindful of minute details, this anime becomes unforgettable for those who like that.
I loved this anime, the entire body of work. Starting with the great story that unfolds simply and directly. Its easy comprehension makes it an anime indicated even the most rustic taste. In itself, the story holds in front of the monitor, making it have great laughs.
Design and graphics, adorable at times and at other iconic make it special. Why did you end up being captivated by moments "kawai".
Because it is a comedy anime, it ends up being more recommended forthose who want something more "light" and fixative to relax. The great defect itself is ever announced a second season, leaving us with a taste of "I want more".\n
Finally, I recommend this anime to all who read this review, it is an anime somewhat unknown, but should be seen and shared with friends.

Just to be clear, 5 isn't a bad score; I'm only saying this show is average.
Harems have always had a bad reputation among people due to their lack of originality. Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru, or NouKome, is no different and is almost exactly what you would expect it to be. It's definitely nothing groundbreaking, as most would expect from a harem, ecchi show. I was originally pretty hyped for this show because the synopsis was interesting and I thought this "absolute choice" plot point described in the synopsis would create some pretty hilarious situations. I wascorrect in this assumption, but as it stands, NouKome is still generic and littered with tropes you often find in harems. Even though it lacks originality, the high amounts of comedy is something worth mentioning, so you shouldn't dismiss NouKome immediately.


The story for this show is mediocre, though it is actually decently original, considering its genre. The basic premise of this show is that our main protagonist, Kanade Amakusa, suffers from a condition, or curse, known as Absolute Choice, which forces you to choose between two options that appear in your head, or else you get severe headaches. Right off the bat, you can probably understand how this element in the story allows for some pretty hilarious moments. Unfortunately, even though this show is quite funny, it still lacks an actual plot. The story doesn't ever go anywhere, and even though Kanade really wants to fix his condition, he doesn't by the end of the show. Granted, this could be to allow room for a second season, though I don't believe there is one announced. This show is listed as a romance, but that's a bit misleading. Most of the girls fall for him, but, to everyone's dismay, he never chooses one of them. The high point of this show is comedy, but some of the jokes simply fall flat, or get watered down by the ecchi elements. It also ends with an obligatory, harem beach episode and its full of extra fanservice. Anyway, you shouldn't try and watch this show for its amazing story line for it has none.


The show is animated fairly well, but so are most shows nowadays. A strange trend that I see in anime that this show has is how everything seems "shiny." Hair, clothes, and skin often reflect so much light that it masks them in a blazing glow. Maybe that's an exaggeration, but everything is still shiny. All the light also seems to have a red tint. It's pretty noticeable, however, it shouldn't detract too much from the anime. Characters move fluidly for the most part. There's really nothing to complain about. I mean, nothing moves like a robot, so you shouldn't be bothered by it for the most part. Every character is drawn pretty well, though they seem to constantly blush, which could annoy some people.


The voice acting is nice, but a lot of the girls have a squeaky, high-pitched voices. It feels like all of the girls are voiced by the same person. The acting isn't bad, but some of the voices get annoying over time. You could also say the voices are cute, so the squeaky voices could be considered a positive. Nothing else of note comes to mind concerning the audio. The music for the OP and ED are actually decent, but nowhere near exceptional.


As you might expect, a lot of the girl's characters in this show are based on generic, harem archetypes. Though, honestly, the girls are unique in some ways and offer a relatively unique twist on their base archetypes. Let's first talk about Kanade Amakusa though: our male lead. I hate to say this, but he's also pretty much another generic archetype. Which archetype? The male lead archetype that is oblivious towards all romantic feelings directed towards him. I'm less mad at the archetype now than the fact that Kanade's barely an original character. Kanade is also kind of snarky and snide. All the girls want to marry him, and he is oblivious of this: that sums him up. Back to the girls. By the fact I constantly refer to them as "the girls," you should understand that they are essentially one big character. To the shows credit, they are pretty quirky in their own way. Chocolat, our female lead, is as funny as she is gluttonous. She falls from the sky in order to help Kanade with his Absolute Choice. She fails at it and that makes her somewhat likable. Most of the time though, character's like Yuouji and Yukihira are just targets for various missions Kanade is given to complete. By the way, Kanade completes missions to prevent him from being stuck with Absolute Choice forever. I don't know how it works, but NouKome doesn't bother explaining it. He's assigned these missions by God who is pretty much the pinnacle of awesome. God is, well, God. He loses points for not letting us see his face though. I should also mention the existence of the Reject 5 and Popular 5. Kanade and much of his harem happen to be in the Reject 5 for they do strange things. Kanade is often forced into those actions because of Absolute Choice.


Character's don't seem to develop in NouKome. They exit the story the way they enter and that proves to be pretty annoying. Again, don't expect much from the story.


It's not like this show is not enjoyable. It's far from it. Characters like Kanade will peeve you off, but its bearable so we can try and ignore it. If you can get past Kanade and his obliviousness, you get to the meat of this show: it's comedy. Some occasional jokes aren't too funny, but most of the humor is chuckle-worthy. Also, most of the complaints I have only become relevant in the last few episodes of this anime, so the first, around 4/5 of NouKome is enjoyable. They really crank up the fanservice in the last portion.


In the end, Noukome is a harem that's got humor going for it. If you have a lot of harems you would like to watch, NouKome should probably be on the top of all those. It's better than a various assortment of harems, but it's still nothing special. Luckily, it's only 10 episodes. I still wouldn't recommend marathoning it, but I would recommend watching it in small doses if you're into harems. Overall, I would say NouKome is an average anime, but fine for people who like ecchi and harem.


5/10

This series may have probably been the most polarizing series I ever watched. On one hand, some of the humor was very creative, the characters looked like they had some amount of depth, and I was genuinely curious to see where the plot was going to go. On the other hand, the series is just downright unpleasant to watch. Most of the humor in the series seems to revolve entirely around the entire universe bending its will to make things worse for or main character Kanade, and the actions that occur are far too cringeworthy to be funny. Despite this, the series seems to havesome type of belief that seeing a likable character have to put himself through psychological torment just for the amusement of god himself, which may as well just be another way of saying that the writer wants him to suffer. This is made even worse due to the fact that the remaining cast is completely unsympathetic towards him and over the course of the series, you start to hate them more because of their obnoxious and uncaring attitude. The entire series is basically nothing but an extended Kanade torture porn, and it is one with a lot of unfortunate implications to boot.


First of all, I will start with the technical aspects. The animation is decent enough and I will give credit in that the soundtrack was very good. Also the voice acting seemed pretty well done to. Admittedly there is not much for me to say during these things considering that I tend to just focus on the story, so naturally that is what my main focus will be on. The main premise of this series is basically that Kanade, our main character, has been cursed with something known as "absolute choice." This causes him to be forced to choose between performing one of two actions at random, both of which are usually degrading or embarrassing, or else he gets continuously inflicted with pain until he makes a choice. Due to this curse, he ends up losing his respect at school and becomes an outcast due to him really weirding everyone else out. He then ends up gaining a choice where he ends up meeting a girl who is supposed to help him rid himself of the curse.


This sounds like an interesting premise, but what ruins it is the execution. For the main storyline and mystery aspect, I cannot comment on much seeing as how the series is not over yet and the first season ends with the mystery left open, and of course despite me wanting to know what happens, I do not want to sit through any more of the bullshit this series has put me through in order to do so. Of course there is a compelling aspect to this series regarding the mystery of why the absolute choice is occurring and whatnot, but it simply is not worth sitting through this terrible series in order see it.


Ultimately there are two major reasons that NouCome fails as a series. The first of which relates to the humor. A premise like this naturally sounds like something that would make for an interesting plot, but at the same time, there would need to be more than just the main premise, otherwise it will feel gimmicky and lazy. See if you can guess what NouCome decides to do with its premise? Actually that is a misleading question seeing as how NouCome executes this in the absolute worst way possible.


Seeing as how we know nothing about why or how these choices occur at random points, there is basically no other way to interpret them other than the author deliberately trying to pick whichever ones are making things things the most inconvenient for the main character, and due to the way this is executed, you would think the author holds some type of personal grudge against his own character. Now as ridiculous an interpretation as this may sound, I have to ask if the series in universe explanation is any better? In this series, the current god is someone who is filling in for the previous god who ended up becoming a shut in, yet the god before her is the one that is causing the absolute choice. We are given several things that are also meant to imply that the shut in god is actually a certain character in the series who has put the main character through even more crap just for her own amusement, and is someone that finds physically and psychologically tormenting someone else funny.


So answer me this, does the author of an anime series technically not have the same position as a god would? Hell the series is basically about the laws of the universe literally turning themselves over just to torture Kanade, therefore there is some type of divine intervention, yet we are never told anything about the third god and he/she is not even a character yet. However, it honestly feels as though this third god is meant to represent the author himself, or in this case even being a self insert.


Considering that the only reason these events happen is basically because “fuck you that’s why,” and that this god is not even made out to be an antagonist and the fact that we are supposed to find this type of crap funny, I can only assume that the author is projecting his own personal ideas onto this unrevealed character, and I have no reason to assume otherwise until Takeru Kasukabe proves he knows how to write a story and gives a decent justification. Honestly that is what a revelation would have to be at this point. It would not be a twist, or a revelation, it would have to be a reason why this crap has happened, and if it does not, then the only way it would work is if we see the person who causes this get repaid the favor tenfold.


There is ultimately a correct way to handle this type of plot, and that way would be if the person that dealt with all this crap was a complete asshole who deserved to have this happen to them. Seeing good people suffer due to someone else’s cruelty is not funny. In fact, it is the exact opposite of funny. It is typically used as a storytelling tool to increase tension and drama. You end up sympathizing with Kanade when these things happen, you never end up laughing at what happens to him, you just get royally pissed off about it and it gets even worse because no one else in the show seems to give a shit about him.


This is where the other problem comes in, just about every character in this show is an unlikable douchebag. In the first few episodes, the characters were not too bad and showed some likability. Unfortunately the episode turned them all into complete assholes with little redeeming quality. Let us go down this list of these characters. First I will start with Chocolat, the girl that is sent to help Kanade. At first she was a nice and loyal character who was likable, and cute. The later episodes ruined this by making her a complete ditz and giving her this obsession with wanting to see Kanade having sex with another man. I am not exaggerating, she keeps spouting out those things all the time and it ruins her character. FIrst of all it makes no sense seeing as how she is from another world and is not human, and it is even touched upon earlier that she doesn’t feel the typical type of attraction. Secondly, just think about this type of action if the gender roles were reversed. There is no way in hell a series would ever get away with it if that was the case.


On that subject, there are a lot of things that this series does that go way beyond what is acceptable. For example, there are several times where Kanade is raped yet the series attempts to downplay it as if it isn’t a big deal. There is a much older woman who seems to have a crush on him and tried to have her way with him by chasing him down, because if there is one subject that is absolutely hilarious, it is statutory rape. ANd that is not even the only instance of it. I will just clarify one thing though, it is not because it uses rape as an attempt at comedy that is a problem, but the reason why is that it is presented as if it is something completely normal and is brushed under the rug. Normally when a series invokes a darker subject matter, it tries to overplay it in an attempt to cross the line twice (IE something like Family Guy or South Park). However in this series, it does not even have any sense of awareness of what it is talking about. NouCome cannot even do shock humor correctly.


Now back on the subject of characters, there are Kanade’s “friends.” I say friends in quotes because I can barely consider them to be his friends with the way they treat him. Like with most characters, they were likable at first but quickly ended up getting worse. Oka admittedly wasn’t too bad with the exception of her laughing when Kanade shoots onion extract up his nose and is on the ground writhing in pain, but Furano was just horrible. Early on she seemed like a typical Kuudere with a quirky and odd sense of humor, but she quickly ends up becoming much worse when we find out that she already loves Kanade but cannot spit anything out, so she treats him like crap and going to the extent to inflict physical harm and repeatedly beat him. None of this makes any sense in the least and it makes her character absolutely abhorrent. Not to mention it leaves a horrible message, :if someone physically abuses you,chances are they actually love you and don’t want you to leave.


Utage is someone who is helping out Kanade because she has had to put up with the Absolute Choice as well. She is also a 29 year old loli. I am not joking, and there is no explanation given either. She comes across as very cold and non-caring, as if she does not even care about Kanade to begin with.


Konagi is probably the most detestable character in the show. Sh is basically the typical overly shy moe girl who would not be so bad, except for the fact that she has a group of fanboys on multiple occasions have kidnaped Kanade, beat him half to death (and one of them has even raped him on multiple occasions, which the show just tries to brush under the rug), and she does nothing to stop them. It is implied that they have also done this to other people that have gotten close to her. She says that she cares for Kanade as a person yet apparently not enough to tell her fanboys to fuck off. Also they are complete hypocrites in that they beat up Kanade for supposedly trying to hit on her despite them sending her a garter belt.


Conclusion


Ultimately this is the problem with NouCome, everyone is an asshole. Not even just the characters themselves, but the universe it takes place in is utterly horrendous. Even without absolute choice, no one ever decides to do anything when Kanade is put through constant harm because of others. Honestly this series has given me the impression that even Takeru Kasukabe must have some type of personal grudge against him. The viewer not caring what happens to the characters of a series is a sign of bad writing, but the writer caring less than his audience is a sign of even worse writing. This series was just painful and unpleasant to watch.


It is a shame this was the case because the first few episodes actually showed some amount of promise in the first 2 episodes, but it quickly falls off a cliff. Also there were some moments that were legitimately funny. Ultimately, it is because of the promise it showed that this show was painful to watch. I kept hoping something would change, and every time I thought it was getting better, it did something to screw itself up. To be honest, if there is a second season, I would still be tempted to watch it just to see if things finally get better for Kanade, but seeing as how Takeru Kasukabe seems to have some type of beef with him, i’m not getting my hopes up.

THIS ANIME MADE ME LAUGH, I was in hysterics through most of every episode. This was partly done by the amazing unique characters and the cliched mixing into one leading to some great comedic moments. Alone the characters could of made me laugh but this anime combined  some of the weirdest and wackiest characters I've ever seen, not to mention the protoganists curse which adds more random to the mix making the show completely unpredictable. 
Unfortunately the anime has its flaws its biggest one for me was the ending, in this case lack there of. The anime seems to end right when things aregetting good, and many things are left unresolved and unanswered. Which is disappointing because even though the plot it self wasn't anything special the mix of characters and the protoganists unique curse made this mundane plot into something great and as I was watching each episode my expectations kept growing but ultimately they were not met.


Overall this anime is great for anyone just looking for a something to laugh at and relax it has and interesting plot and a great set of characters. 


Overall rating is 7/10 I would love to give this anime a higher rating as the characters and enjoyment are at least 9/10 if not 10/10, however the lack of an ending and the amount of unanswered questions just made the anime feel incomplete.

“My Mental Choices Are Completely Interfering with my School Romantic Comedy” Aka, “Noucome,” (which is probably what I’m going to call it from now on in the review), was an anime that really surprised me in both enjoyment and quality. After reading the summary, I was expecting a nonsensical, random, shoujo with girls with huge boobs and large eyes eating pieces of toast with jam and looking as adorable as possible. And while this was indeed true, I had fun with it otherwise and its insane plot is surprisingly well-developed.
Story: 9
I found myself shaking my head after first reading the summary. “This is just anothershoujo,” I thought. “It won’t be any different from the others,” I thought; but then I realized how fun the plot actually sounded and tried at the first episode. Basically, in a nutshell, the story revolves around a young, handsome, high school boy Kanade Amakusa, who everyone has pushed aside as one of the “Reject Five” even though he used to be quite popular. This is only because of a disability, if you will, he gained last year that caused multiple choice questions to appear in his head to solve real life conflicts. Many of these solutions are usually perverted and weird. One thing led to another and he became unpopular, finally. This is a harem genre anime in which Kanade is surrounded by the other girls in the Reject Five. It’s basically a growing love story with hilarious elements mixed in between. I love how the anime knew that the plot seemed very “archetypical” and decided to play around with it a little. A humorous mood is always surrounding the air of this anime. I was really disappointed though, at the fact that was only 10 episodes long. I believe it would’ve been a lot less compacted and would’ve been much more humorous if the anime extended a few episodes more. Haha, or maybe that’s just me not wanting it to end. I guess the element that did the most for this anime was the irony. I mean, a conflict would erupt and instead of finding the most serious and calming solution as possible, Kanade takes the hard, humorous route and entertains us with his constant failure. I could not stop laughing at his constant catastrophes and screw-ups, because then we get to see more Kanade tries to start all over again. Overall, the plot was very well developed and there seemed to be very little holes and confusion. 9


Art: 8


The art is fricking adorable. I mean, I know I don’t normally don’t like that kind of thing and I don’t really approve of the flashing titties and skirts… but I couldn’t help  but I couldn’t help it. The art style and design, with the bright colors, large eyes, cute patterns… It just fit the anime really well and there’s no denying that fact. It really had a well impact on the whole entire humorous and fun aspect of the anime. It wasn’t too serious, and it was pretty cute. Kanade was the only character that I believe could’ve been designed better. I mean, he was supposed to be “handsome.” That was his image, and that’s who he used to be; but I just didn’t see it. Also, I wouldn’t say the movement of the anime is very pretty; the only thing that got me was the color. Still very well executed. 7


Sound: 7


Okay, nothing was very special about the OST soundtrack. That was a big flaw in the anime. I would expect a cute, bubbly, song that cheers everyone up and is almost nonsensical to the plot, but I didn’t get anything like that, so I was pretty disappointed. The opening was pretty cute though, I mean, you have all of these adorable little girls, why not use them for a well-choreographed dance number? Normally I don’t like that kind of thing, but once again, it fit the anime really well. Now, for the voice acting. Okay, you can tell that the actors had LOADS of fun filming this anime, especially the actor for Kanade. He had so many different moods and tones in his voice that just cracked me up, so Kudos to him for keeping a straight face through it all. The acting was really well done for all the girls.


Characters: 8


Ah, my favorite thing to analyze. I won’t analyze all of the characters because there are just too damn many. That’s a weakness point or two to take away from the anime’s characters. Sorry, but too many characters is a reoccurring issue in anime these days and I many are added just for a small something that plays insignificant to the story and that mainly ends up screwing with the story a bit. And you’d think, in that entire sea if characters, that I would hate a few, but I really didn’t. The variety of the characters’ personalities and different viewpoints and sources of humor ADDED to the anime and just added more laughs. I mean, yeah, some characters were insignificant, like that one “little sister character” but I couldn’t help but enjoy the variety. I had to see it coming though, I mean, it IS a harem, duh, Stupid Hattie. And seriously, I even laughed at the side characters that seemed to play no value to the story, such as the “Flippant God,” (OMG he was hilarious) or his ugly neighbor who is a “boy lolicon.” 


Enjoyment: 10

This anime was fricking hilarious. The randomness along with the amazing elements and characters really got me hooked. It would always cheer me up and I have never loved a shoujo anime like this. I hope they make more of this anime so I can get a less ambiguous ending and a refreshing second season. 


Overall: 8/9

My Mental Choices are Completely Interfering with my School Romantic Comedy / Ore no Nonai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Rabu Kome o Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru (Noucome)
Review By: John Fragglepuss Evans
This anime is so funny because Kanade will be in the most normal of circumstances and then all of the sudden has to choose between two or more choices of something to say or do that is completely ridiculous or embarrassing. This is a funny anime that has some romance to it.
You might enjoy this if: You are looking for a comedy full of nonsense and randomness. The choices presented are so absurd that they willmake you laugh. To top it off, Kanade has to make a decision with every absurd choice.\n\n
You might not like it if: You are looking for something that is not lighthearted and silly. The story is not the best out there, but it is a fun anime to watch.\n\n
Note to the Viewer: Make sure to watch until the very end of every episode, after the credits have concluded. It shows what would have happened had Kanade chosen a different choice from the episode. It’s hilarious!

Definitely a must-view.Those classics that everyone knows or should know

This show is madness. As long as you have a crass sense of humour and are an anime-viewer of dubious self-respect, you should probably go ahead and check this out. The jokes are generally less tame and hit-or-miss than those you find in other anime, and the writers did a great job at injecting satire of a bunch of anime tropes into the show. The result is a delightful cocktail of preposterous ecchi humour, caricatural harem dynamics and dirty slapstick gags that would make a serious audience retch.
There are bad episodes, and these tend to be where they shift from inane humour to basic high-schoolsoapy stuff and don't make enough use of the clearly considerable creative wit they possess. Still, those are only few compared to the mainstream of ****s and giggles, and you can tell exceedingly clearly what you're going to be getting with this show from the first episode.


I admit, despite never intending to watch this each morning for anything other than a bit of comedy, Yukihira grew on me - her cute design aside, her main voice-actor, bizarre deadpan humour and schizophrenic awkwardness gave her a good dose of charm. Aside from that I was pretty meh about the other characters and plotlines for anything other than lulz, which – to be fair - they provided amply.



Overall, unless you have a stick up your butt, do yourself a favour and give it the twenty minute test. It's very, very fun.

I'll be referring to this series as Noukume to save me the trouble of typing its title.
Romantic comedy harem series are a dime a dozen these days. Once in a blue moon, a series pops up from this crowded genre and separates it self from its brethren. Noukome belongs to the chosen few that brings something truly enjoyable to the table despite its generic cast and shows how execution can make a difference.
We are introduced to Amakusa Kanade. A healthy fine looking young lad that is living a normal high school life or so we were led to believe. Kanade actually has a condition calledAbsolute Choice where he has to choose from usually outrageous options given to him by a voice inside his head and unless he chooses one he will be tormented by a severe headache. This condition continued to ruin his life until one day he was given the chance to rid himself of Absolute Choice by god himself. He has to complete insane missions given to him or else he will be haunted with Absolute Choice for the rest of his life.


The characters is truly a strong point of Noukome in spite of having almost or if not all your run of the mill harem character archetypes. The real magic in these characters is how well they entertain you with their crazy antics and maximize the use of their archetypes by playing with their strengths. Their dialogues and interactions are genuinely hilarious which at times deliberately attacks some of animes oldest cliche such as the infamous censor.


For the art and animation all I can say is that there's nothing noteworthy about them. They're pretty average at best. The character design reeks and screams mediocre. Not saying that it isn't attractive or anything.


The sound chosen for the series really suits the mood and sets the right atmosphere for it. The opening theme S.M.L is an energetic warm up to start the show while the ending theme Taiyou to Tsuki no Cross gives off this feeling of "mission accomplished" which ends the show in a good note. The voice actors did a good job in playing their characters most notably Kondou Yui(as Furano) and Ohzora Naomi(as Yuragi). It was enjoyable to see how well they play with their characters by adapting multiple personas especially Naomi.


The only problem with this series is that it's way too short even compared to other seasonal anime who usually have 12-13 episodes. It leaves the viewers wanting for more which in a way isn't a bad thing for opening a path for a second season. To sum it up, Noukume is a fun anime to watch that leaves its audience in a state of ecstasy in its wake.

Try to keep an open mind. At first glance this is not my sort of thing, but that's because of the character designs. Looking at the picture while writing this I see another school comedy with a harem theme, not really my thing. But this is not really a kids anime, this has too much raunchy humor to pass for kids. And that's why I loved it! Sure there's some offensive material, and it may require trigger warnings for some. But as an adult I liked it. It's not like it was genuinely Kanade Amakusa's fault. Ultimate choice serves as a stupendous plot device andsource of comedy; it's just too funny not to want to keep watching. The only thing is the character design, but once I got past that I was along for the ride. All the characters are adorable and it never loses it's humor or charm.\n
The real star of this show though is Furano Yukihira the girl who sits behind Kanade in class. She has a weird sense of humor and will often tell jokes with a blank expression. She seems to have feelings for Kanade, but exhibits a tsundere attitude towards him. She's so conflicted and real that it almost breaks your heart. Yuragi Hakoniwa is cliche but funny in her own unique way. The only character I wasn't feeling was Utage Dōraku, Amakusa's homeroom teacher and someone who was afflicted with the "Absolute Choices" curse in the past. I didn't like her because she has the appearance of an elementary school girl, despite being 29 and felt the show could have used one real woman reference.\n
Other than that it excels at what it offers.

Why is Noucome so good?
I will attempt to explain this awesomeness in as few words as possible. 
Kanade, the main character, is a huge perv. A powerful supernatural force is forcing Kanade to make pervy decisions. This supernatural power sends Kanade a tenshi/angel by the name of Chocolat. She lies on his couch and eats snacks, and she is also a huge perv. The supernatural force continues forcing Kanade to make pervy choices. Kanade eventually realizes that the worst thing that can possibly happen to him after making these pervy choices will be that he will be beat up, possibly expelled from school, or possiblysurrounded by a variety of confusing romantic choices. And then something else might happen.

Ore no nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru is one of the most bland anime I've seen. It's not terrible, it's just disappointing.
When I heard about an anime with a premise like this one I was genuinely intrigued, considering the fact that something interesting in a harem anime is most of the time a far-fetched ideal. Turns out it wasn't worth my time after all, at least it was somewhat short.
What really ruins this anime for me are the characters, our main character is alright actually, but all his potential 'love' interests are either boring or just weird in abad way. They have no true emotions and the story just plays out with nothing interesting to look forward to because of that.


Normally I would've dropped an anime like this, not because it's THAT terrible, but just because it isn't my cup of tea. I can recommend it if you truly like harem, otherwise I would skip this one.
