Life is full choices. Its up to us if what we choose is good or bad. Well in my case, when I decided to watch this, I felt really bad. Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru is about a guy who has a curse called absolute choices wherein he will forcefully choose an option on what to do on a certain situation. Well in other words, he is like a main character in a Visual Novel. And what's more, the options are all weird. Something like this might make you hooked up. Well, believe me, its not whatyou are thinking of. This show doesn't have a decent story, just full of fanservices and gags that are not even funny. The characters are even weird(I think they were designed like that but I didn't really like it). What I don't like about this show is its weirdness. Yeah I think its weird. I didn't even giggle. One thing that I can praise about this show is its art. Yeah it has a good art but that's all. Well if you're into fanservices, this is your show but to those who like to watch something with a great story, don't even bother.

Welp here's the bottom line if you are getting into this. For all you dirty otacos out there looking for something fun to watch. JUST DO IT! It has a very good slapstick humor thing going on. In which totally kept my little hamster wheel brain occupied! 
Though there are scenes here and there where they throw jokes that are more targeted towards the Japanese heavily influence culture. So unless you are a knee deep otacos or minimally literate it wont be as funny.
Fan service is a yes because it can and it should. My primal instinct should be tickled and my jimmy should berustled. It isn't balls deep like To LOVE-Ru, but the protagonist gets into a pretty decent amount of trouble if ya know what I mean...


Plot is fair, as it can tend to be slightly stereotypical. Though upon close inspection it does try at being different. Different as in giving the main character a disease that requires him to make choices...life choices. Although it's not like every waking moment he will be making them hardcore parkour ERABES( choices) . He will only MOST of the time be making ridiculous and random choices. That ultimately humiliates him and sometimes spur on flags with different girls.


As for girls, well it's a harem so it's a walk into the candy store. What do you wanna taste today? Airheads?Spicy mexican candy? Tootsie pop? COLD ice candy? Or maybe some thing serious like vanilla? 


There is a lot of hot baes, But most importantly.. can you get to the center of the tootsie pop? I say yes. And if you don't get what I'm getting at there's a moderate amount of character/love progression. You definitely will find it pushing along the main character and the heroines of the story. Though half of the time it sorta gets shut down..

All main and sub genres, 10/10. Art is perfect, The voice actors are AMAZING. Couldn't have been done better. All sound effects fit in perfectly. There isn't much more to say about the story, It's simply a great idea. The character development is pretty much what the series is about, Kanade and his companions and how their relationship to eachother changes as the series progress. Since theres this "touch" of Ecchi (theres actualy quite a bit) It also adds up to the overall enjoyment of the show.
I strongly recommend you to watch this series, it's just great. Masterpiece for real comedy/romance/ecchi lovers.

To begin with, this is definitely the best anime I have ever watched ( under the genre of romance / comedy anyway) .  
For starters, this is unlike most anime plot and it does its own thing rather than being a bit of everything.  This is the main reason why I love it.  Unlike other anime such as Boku wa Tomodachi ga sukunai ( Haganai ), where a sense of reality is present with a hint of fiction is involved, Noucome (Ore no nounai sentakushi ..... ) isn't like that.
In Noucome, one cannot simply relate to its situations directly to the viewer'slife.  For example, in reality, one would certainly pick up a H (perv) magazine and either eat it or smell it.  These are not something that a normal person would do in real life.  This is a major factor that I love it.

In addition, in most anime (that I've watched), the producers would make the show relate-able to the audience.  The producers of this ignores this completely and do their own thing.  Hence the wacky-ness of the choices in this show.


As I have mentioned in the last sentence, choices.  Yes, unlike other shows, the protagonist as well as the audience faces these choices, making this feeling like a galge ( dating sim game, targeted towards male) or a graphic novel. I'm not a big fan of these games myself but I admire how they link this towards this show, creating an effect which tries to engage itself with the audience.  


Unlike most of the other shows I have watched, the drawing technique is in a league of its own in my opinion.  Unlike Yuushibu or Wake up, Girls! , they make the characters so kawaii, including the main character itself.  The way how each character blushes to their pouting faces to their crying face, it's almost like a puppy.  You just want to grab it and console it.  


The plot itself is very unusual.  It is simply impossible to predict what could happen next because of the mental choices.  So the story is like a roller coaster ride.  You don't know what it is like unless you sit down and experience every single moment of it.


To conclude, if you're like me.  I enjoy crazy plot twists, impossible stunts, situations in reality that will never come up, complicated love and a good laugh, this is truly the perfect anime for you.

(slight spolier)

Also, there are clips at the end of each episode telling you what would happen if the main character chose a different decision.

don`t expect a heavy laid out storyline because there isnt one...
story: 
Kanade Amakusa, a regular high school student expect for one thing...... the ultimate choices curse. The first thing you should know is that this anime serie was not made to have an intense storyline with extreme drama etc.... it was made for those who enjoy the lighter series where everything that normally would be serious is taken as a joke. What makes ore no nounai so successful is how well they pull it off. Think about it he has a terrible curse on him that will obviously cause him a lot of misery howeverbecause of that very same curse he gets more and more involved with the characters around him making obvious room for a harem.You probably think so typical but his harem is necessary in the storyline as it reveals Kanade`s kind nature and leads us along the little bit of seriousness that is present. In other words its keeps the serie moving without making itself the story. 


Art :

the overall Art in noucome is amazing as to be expected from the new series coming out recently. The detail for the character and their surroundings are awsome and i think plenty of effort has been put into them. The colours are beautifully bright not to mention i love the artwork for the eyes and chocolates super cute outfit!!! (ahem) i think plenty of work was put into to it and it is quite wonderful.


Sound: 

I really like the opening song for noucome i think it is open and playful and perfect for the serie it is representing and the right music was used to create the right moods.


character:

What i really like about noucome is that altough on the outside they all seemed like the typical dere`s they all had a twist that most characters dont have not to mention their constant need to go WAY over the top compared to your regular dere`s wich obviously was done purposely.


Enjoyment:

If you consider that i spend alot of the serie with tears in my eyes from laughter i cant deny anything. I really enjoyed the serie it was a nice break from my usual serious storyline anime series. The overall humour was great and it was something different to me i loved it.

I thought the concept of this anime was good, but the actual work? No. The curse was pretty cool, but all it made him do was really embarrassing or pervy things. I guess some people are into that, but not me. Despite all of the horrible things he does, he magically gets a harem. That happens all the time in anime and it needs to stop. Girls aren't really that shallow. I was kind of curious as to the nature of his curse, and how 
he was going to deal with it, but by the end he hasn't really accomplished much and knows very little.He does discover some things, and the show can be funny, but that doesn't compensate for the stupidity of the show

Overall - 6:
The introduction scene about choices was really well done (even if I had to keep pausing to read the choices). The set up for this show is fine, but the way it's handled isn't.
Story - 5:
The concept of forcing the main character to pick between some options can create some hilarious situations, this show was at it's best when it was trying to make the viewer laugh with some over the top situation caused by absolute choice. The problem is that this wasn't always the focus.
When the show focuses on the characters and building up Kanade's harem it feels generic and boring. Thisis mostly due to the characters not being all that interesting.


The plot allows for some ridiculous scenarios, but it rarely uses this to its full potential. More often than not the choice is merely a distraction, which is only good when it adds to the comedy of the situation.


Art - 5:

Generic anime art, nothing special, it's not good or bad. The way the absolute choice is presented is done well though.


Sound - 6:

The OST is good, and the sound effects are decent as well.


Character - 2:

This is where Noucome really fell flat for me. The main character is the generic indecisive harem anime protagonist and his only redeeming quality is the empathy you can feel for him and the way he handles some of the situations he's in. He also says he'll never chose something that could hurt the feeling of another person, which generally means he makes a bad decision because he's being "considerate".


The rest of the cast are boring, generic, or lack any sort of depth. Any somewhat interesting character is glazed over in place of the main cast. Throughout the anime they refer to a group of people as the "reject five" but as you find out later in the anime, there aren't even five of them, which makes no sense.


The only character that is likeable and gets at least some screen time is the teacher. She really should  have been a bigger part of the anime than she was.


Enjoyment - 5:

There were times this anime made me laugh, but they weren't enough to distract me from dreadfully boring characters.

When I originally read the synopsis I thought it would be interesting. Sadly it was a let down. You can see this from the get-go but, I choose to endure thinking it would redeem itself. While it does get better it is only a little and it is in the last 3 episodes.
The story itself is summed up in the phrase "dating game" where you have to make a choice otherwise you won't be able to proceed with the story. The issue here is that the choices are so absurd that they're trying too hard to be funny. Eventually the choices begin to make moresense or have more of a 'realistic' choice to them but, it was so late in the game that it didn't really save the show.


The art was standard for its time and still holds up till today. You can see some short cuts they take but, otherwise it won't hurt your eyes to look at.


The sound is a bit lacking as you will hear repeating effects and of course "CHOOSE" so many times that it just gets to be annoying.


Given the story the characters suffer- you have the classic troupes of Crazy, Lovable Idiot, Can't Speak her Mind, and Onee-chan. The development of these characters were almost non-existent, at one point they were developing the character of one of the main leads but, it eventually got dropped for a sad attempt of humor. At the end the characters are where they started without any difference except for 'its now a harem'.


The comedy in this show is pretty dry leaving me wanting the entire time. The best of it comes from the side characters of a girl who acts as her 'royal guard'. Every time they were on the screen I was laughing. Otherwise it was pretty droll and I was just waiting for something to happen.

Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru, or to shorten, Noucome. It is a light novel based on Takeru Kasukabe anime and anime premiered in 2013.
STORY: The anime tells the story of Kanade Amakusa. Kanade is a somewhat special teenager, as this gifted with a curse, "the curse of absolute elections." This curse forces him to have to opt for a series of not very nice choices for him or for them in public. You would think that would not have to choose, but it is inevitable, because if you do not choose at a certain time, the headbegins to ache. These decisions undoubtedly spoil the way that people see him in carrying out any of these elections ...


When he think you he have to continue the rest of his life, a girl, apparently sent by God himself, to help him overcome a series of tests that allow he to get rid of lifetime that curse appears that forced to choose inopportune situations.


Because of their nefarious actions accordingly election, will become one of the five rejected from the school, damaging his reputation within the school, but benefiting, when meeting new friends who will accompany you throughout the anime and its lifetime.


The tests that allow he to get rid of the curse will not be entirely easy, surely making God pass good times laughing at situations that commands him to do, provided that if at any time fail one of the tests, will to stay with the curse of life.


CHARACTERS:

Kanade: Kanade is the main character of the series who is suffering from "Absolute Choices", a curse that forces him to choose one of two or more options. If he doesn't choose, he develops an unbearable migraine. In the beginning, he meets Chocolat and learns that to end the curse, he has to complete a series of "missions". Failing to finish any mission before its deadline will result in the curse staying forever. As the result of "Absolute Choices", his classmates view him as a weird person and thus he has become one of the "Reject Five".


Chocolat: The beautiful girl who falls from the sky after Amakusa chooses the option "a beautiful girl falls from the sky" when given an Absolute Choice on his way home from school one day. She chooses the name "Chocolat" when Kanade gives her a box of chocolates to eat. She was sent from the God World to help Kanade complete the "missions" in order to remove the curse. However, she is quite air-headed, making her ineffective when assisting Kanade. According to her, she lost her memory prior to receiving the mission, including how to resolve the curse. In the second novel, she transfers into Kanade's class as his "pet".

Sometimes, when she bumps her head or gets drunk, an inner Chocolat, who has not lost her memories, appears for a short time. Unlike her counterpart, this Chocolat is smart, helpful, and has a better idea about the curse. She reverts to her usual self if she bumps her head again or becomes sober. According to her, Chocolat will return to the god world once the curse has ended. At one point, after regaining her memory, she tries to seduce Kanade, but fails because of a chocolate box hitting her head, returning her to normal.


ART: The anime does not have many effects. It is an anime that develops life at school and therefore not needed many special effects. They could have been better drawn characters and landscapes, as it becomes an anime that teaches you the landscapes of urban Japan, and very poorly.


Enjoyment: The anime is fun, and it's a comedy that makes you laugh at the various decisions that Kanade has to overcome. If it is true that could be better and have an argument that makes you hook up a little more.

Life is a series of choices. 
That is the basis of this anime.
Story: 7/10 
I found this anime's story to be nothing fantastic. Every episode it jumps around at different stories focusing from each character to the main protagonist; something I did not like, personally. For example, they would focus on a girl and then the next episode they would focus on the other. And personally, I did not find the comedy that hilarious however, there were parts i did laugh and enjoy.  
Art: 7/10
I did not find anything in the art outstanding or appealing to my tastes but I did like the waythe characters were animated/drawn. \n\n
Sound: 7/10\n
The ost and ed were not memorable to me. No soundtrack really stuck to me. \n\n
Character: 7/10\n
The characters were all different from each other and very different from the typical, regular characters. There seems to be two sides to each character. However, I wish there was some more character development and some more deeper characters that show their back story and background. \n\n
Enjoyment: 7/10\n
Some episodes I very much enjoyed and others I found boring, so it was quite the roller coaster for me. Sadly, the ending for me was quite unsatisfying so I can't give this category a great rating. It was alright, certainly some funny times in there. \n\n
Overall: 7/10\n
Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru is a very light heart-ed anime. It teaches you about the decisions and choices you make in your life. Watch it if you have time or if you're bored.

Best anime this season. The story was kind of boring, but since the it was funny I still really enjoyed it. The characters were also very funny, but in my opinion they killed one of them in the last couple episodes. The soundtrack was perfect, it really fit and of course the music was good. To sum it up in one word, 'toplel'

Choices, life is full of choices, no matter what direction you turn or person you encounter in the end, as history has shown, you will have to make a choice.
What I have written above is the premise for the show, and unbelievably, even though this show is full of ecchi and comedy, it sticks by it really well. How each episode is formulated is with the main character going throughout his day having to face a curse which instructs him to randomly choose between doing 2 or 3 things that are related to the on going situation he is in. They also throw in atwist fairly soon and allow the main character to get rid of his curse if he completes several horrendous missions. These two main plot points, as well as the fact that his mental choices have resulted in him being in the group with the five most infamous students, makes for a really comedic show, with ample time to crack jokes, have comedy and humor while still following the overall story. The great thing about this show is that its atmosphere isn't meant to be taken too seriously but still draws a fine line of "crazy" where it's due. 


An important note for the following information is that my rating is based on the basis of good subbed version, or rather one with very simple text and only complex when needed.  I have found the quality of humor in this show drop drastically if watched with bad subs, as it makes jokes harder to follow and if the text is too complex, you will be trying to figure out what the character means instead of the context. 


Here are the overall scores I gave this show:


Story 8

The story itself I believe is genius, they figured out how to include all the cliches and typical troupes into an anime in which it actually works, unlike others. If you want more of a serious show I would avoid this because the questions the curse asks are, by my definition, stupid. However the series plays with that and results into some funny situations. In addition, the fact that his friends aren't the typical types of characters but rather multiple troupes mashed into one allows progress in the story much more easier and makes watching less stressful than if everyone were high-strung and obnoxious. 

Sadly, at the end, there was a bit of a rush and what could have been completely cleared up became another day's issue. 


Art 7

Now this is what I was the most torn about, the art was what is was, nothing particularly good, but it was cute and had the emotions of the characters expressed to a good extent. The animation was typical of a high school show, and as any show had a good episode where the animation was that of a movie. I like to include the category of animation into art as well so my rating is a mix of both.


Sound 8

The characters were very good with what they did, I usually don't rate animes in regards to their sound because unlike other things, if you pay attention to sound you can be heavily influenced as it's much more of a preference rather than something absolute. With that being said, the character's emotions were definitely expressed well with the voices given. The opening and endings were nice songs as well, nothing too horrendous, but even so, I'm not going to remove marks from a show because of the music, I only add marks when it's particularly good and/or unique; of course I will have to remove them if it ruins the entire mood of the show but that has yet to happen since anime studios are good with soundtracks and openings.


Character 8

Besides being the leader of a typical tasteless harem, the main character makes it clear as to whom he doesn't like as each girl is added, so even though I will definitely agree that this show is a harem, it doesn't take away from the show. Each girl in the cast "likes" the main character simply due to the progression of the story and the fact that he is actually, yes believe it or not, hot. The main character is a very attractive dude in the eyes of both the male and females at his school but can't get a girlfriend or get remotely close because of his curse that causes him to act randomly and weird. 


Each character in this show has their own surprises except one or two. The actions the main character makes aren't like other harems, while other shows will have a dense and/or nervous reck playing the lead, in this show, while he does have intense feelings towards females, knows what he wants and doesn't get punched or slapped when he goes into awkward situations. While the whole cast things he's perverted, he in actuality is quite normal and acts like the typical guy. Even in scenarios where the sexual tension becomes high, we aren't questioning as to what this guy is going to do but rather what the girl will do, which is a nice change.  


Enjoyment 9

This show had me laughing every single episode, for more than half the episode. So when you think about it, every single joke would get me laughing and every moment where there were no jokes I could still have been laughing.


Overall 8.4

This show was a blast to watch, as to why I gave it an 8.4 would be things for the bad ending and that there were some things I wished that could happen that didn't happen. But in the end, this show, I wouldn't say that it is a show you watch when you are bored, but a show where you want to have fun. It's not mild enough for casual watching as you won't have the will to follow the jokes, but if you are looking for something that is fun I would certainly check this anime out.

Alright I feel like I'm writing this review at a random time but I've watched this anime 2 or 3 times and it is my favorite anime and honestly I liked it so much I just have to write a review on it.

Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru, Or as its better know as Noucome. Is the kind of anime you watch when you are either just starting to watch anime or you are looking for a anime to take up time. Well, that was a waste of a premise that didn't suck per se.  Alas the execution was quite bad. Unless, of course, you're perfectly satisfied with tired slapstick humour, boobies, panties, boobies, and more boobies.  I'm not.
So, the premise is that our hero is suddenly subjected to attention by a quite flippant god, whose grand idea is to inflict a curse on him.  Said curse consists of him being presented with a choice between two (or more) bad options, and always at a time when either choice will embarrass him.  In order to try and get rid of the curse, hehas to fulfill equally embarrassing "missions".  Forget backstory, why this is happening, why it's happening to Amakusa in specific -- we get none of that.  This has overall the feel of immature gods using humans for entertainment.   You can see the perfect setup for a comedy, can't you.


And I can see how this could be good even without any backstory.  In the hands of a better writer, this could be comedy gold. I enjoyed the role of the flippant god, very aptly voiced by Tachibana Shinnosuke.


Alas I didn't enjoy much else.  It's basically a harem show bordering on ecchi with not enough redeeming features for those who don't inherently love that sort of feeble sexual teasing.


Story:  silly but potentially fun premise, lousy follow-through.  There was no progression, no pacing, no growth (yes, even a comedy should have some of that or it won't touch me at all), no sense (who all is in on the curse?), and no conclusion.


Art:  quite pleasant; bright and clean with decent animation.  Character design makes all the main characters easy to distinguish.  Cute girls, but not too cute.  Too much blush; sheesh.


Sound: a couple of good voice acting performances, the usual professionalism from the rest, too many squeaky female voices (personal peeve), peppy OP (by some random female idol group) and ED, inoffensive BGM.


Character:  Amasuka is your basic bland insert-yourself-here character.  He's not as annoying as some of those are, he's not as pervy as many of them, and he actually has a sense of personal ethics, so he's a step up from the basic model, but why anyone would want to declare their love for him is beyond me.  Yeah, yeah, otaku wishfulfillment, I get it.  The girls are mostly stock:  kuudere, childhood friend secretly in love, wannabe imouto, classy and mysterious student council president, haughty, sadistic ojousama, magical girlfriend who falls from the sky and acts like a puppy (ok, so that last bit is not stock) -- Chocolat is actually a character I like just because she's different, though I hated it when they had her do a turn as the perfect waifu.  There's no character development.


Enjoyment:  I am astounded I made it through all 10 episodes.  Now, they were at the end of my day, and I was mostly vegetating already; that might explain it.  It's not so horrible a show that I'd throw the box against the wall if I had bought it; it has small moments that even I found funny (I enjoyed the short bits after the ED where for some episode we got shown a possible outcome had Amakusa chosen differently, and as already mentioned I rather liked the flippant  god).  But I can't say I actually enjoyed myself, no.  The fan service was so pervasive that the show needed some intellectual stimulation for me to make up for that, and it didn't bring that.

Imagine the "would you rather" game. Now imagine you were playing that game nonstop 24/7. That is what the main guy is faced with. A voice tells him to pick an answer from these horrible embarrassing choices and he has to chose one otherwise he gets bad headaches. That is what makes this anime so funny. He's always doing embarrassing crazy things because of these choices. This anime incorporates many types of humor all into one show. There's puns, sex jokes, gay jokes, and just everything really. He has his harem of girls that are all odd but cute and funny. There's a lot ofpanty shots and funny ecchi scenes. I was laughing from episode one till the last one. The comedy in this show is just too good. Lets go over the main cast. First we have Amakusa Kanade the main guy. He's caring, always making retorts to the other cast when they aren't making any sense or being weird(all the time) and just like a lot of harem men he is dense to all the girls feelings. Then there's Chocolat. She is a busty airhead who loves to eat food and sweets and is pretty much a freeloader. Then we have Yukihira Furano. She has a harsh cold attitude around people but she's actually a sensitive fragile girl. She's always making weird jokes and is very tsundere. Lastly we have Yuuouji Ouka. She is an energetic loving girl that seems like nothing fazes her but she has a pure maiden type mindset at times. The interaction among the cast is just too funny and Kanade's retorts around a crazy weird cast are just as funny. Give this anime a watch.

It's worth noting that I watched the first four episodes of Noukome a couple of months earlier than I watched the rest.
Honestly, I really wanted to like it. The premise is good, a highschool student is randomly forced to choose between often ridiculous and embarrassing choices. If he doesn't, he experiences extreme physical pain. To lift this "curse", he must complete a series of near impossible, and ludicrous missions. It's a good set-up. So I guess I should explain why I didn't like this anime.
The first reason is probably "Chocolat", the support character meant to be helping the Protagonist. To put it bluntly, she's completelyfan-service. She can pull cute faces, do what should be cute things, but it's non-stop with her, and it makes her character boring. She could be redeemable if she wasn't an airhead all of the time, but honestly, if she wasn't a character I don't think it would have changed much. There's an episode where she's not like this, and honestly it's a good episode. She's a lot of fun to watch when she's serious, and it makes her cute scenes all the better when they happen. \n
The second reason is the protagonist himself. At the beginning of the anime he's introduced as a normal guy plagued by the curse which ends up making everyone think he's a weirdo. Because of the curse he's labelled one of the "reject 5", the 5 lowest people on the popularity list. It is set up that everything strange about him is a series of coincidence, misunderstanding and of course, the curse. By the end of the anime he ends up actually just being a weirdo. It tries to touch back to misunderstanding in some scenes, but it doesn't really work. It bugs me that he wasn't overly consistent.\n
Personality seems to be an on-going problem, especially with the other supporting characters. Yuouji, Seira and most of the other characters seem to be more of a list of stereotypes and defining traits rather than characters. There's a lot of explaining or showing a dominant trait for each of them, but not a lot of development or interests/likes/dislikes explained. It's difficult to become invested in them. The exception to this is Yukihira, who receives a lot of development over the course of the series. \n
The comedy isn't bad either, I can see it's funny, but I'm struggling to laugh at it. I get in a good chuckle here and there, but something about the choices make it seem really forced at times. Maybe that's apart of the joke? I'm not sure, but if you've seen the first episode, you've already seen the highlight of the series. The art style is different too, not bad, but again, something about it just doesn't sit too well with me.\n
It's not a bad anime by any means. It's just not particularly good either. If you have some time and you're interested in where it might take you, give it a watch. But if you're really after something that will keep you invested, maybe something else.

So Sentakushi is another High School romcom with way too much fanservice to be taken even remotely seriously. I was all-in-all very disappointed with this anime, because the premise seemed interesting, a boy with a “Absolute Multiple Choice”, meaning that on occasion he’ll see 2+ choices, and he has do do/pick one of the choices, or he’ll get an increasingly painful headache very quickly. The catch, is that these choices are often completely ridiculous to the point of sheer stupidity.
Our story picks up with a really cool scene all about how choices shaped the world that we live in today. Soon after this ends, wemeet our protagonist, Kanade Amakusa. Kanade has recently developed his Absolute Choice curse for little-to-no explained reason, and as a result, his reputation has quickly taken a nose dive due to his otherwise unexplained bouts of randomness and creepiness (IE, streaking, acting like a pig, sexual molestation/touching) One day, Kanade is walking home from school when suddenly his AMC starts acting up, and due to his choice, “A beautiful young girl falls from the sky”. This girl has amnesia, and all she knows is that she is from heaven. It is soon revealed that the girl loves food, and when she attempts to eat Kande’s expensive chocolates, she asks, “Do you love chocolates?” resulting in her choosing her name as Chocolat. After choosing between death, and letting Choclat stay (which, of course, he chose the latter), our hero soon receives a phone call from God! After proving that he really is God through a series of funny means, he informs Kande that there is a way to remove his AMC curse. As it turns out, the only way to remove the curse is by successfully completing a series of “trials” with the help of Chocolat. 


The characters in this series were interesting enough, albeit copy/paste of other popular characters and archetypes; but the problem lies in the complete lack of character development, even when it would have been incredibly easy and more satisfying. There are many important secondary in this anime, and as a result, I’ll only be covering four of the members of the Reject 5 (the least popular kids on campus). Furano Yukihara is a strange combination of Tsundere and Kuudere, though I can’t really complain about this… odd mixture due to her pulling it off quite well. My problem with Yukihara is that she had so much behind the scenes character development, yet she is never fully utilized. Regardless, she (in my opinion) has way too much Tsun and virtually no Dere. The last major character that I’ll talk about is Yuoji Oka, a Deredere character that is mostly immune to Kanade’s strangeness (and sexual advances, to an extent) due to her own out-there and crazy personality.


Once again, nothing really stuck out musically, including the opening or closing credits. The opening video, however, was at least interesting and complemented the show in just the perfect atmosphere and humor.


I’d love to rant about the ending and the waaaaaaay underused character, but I’m trying to keep these spoiler-free.


Overall, I, as I said earlier, am very disappointed in this show’s lack fulfilling of potential. It had a very interesting premise, and if it had been handled with a bit more maturity, Sentakushi could have been a diamond in the rough of romcoms. I’m going to have to give this a 6/10 just because it had enough plot and questions to keep me coming back. 


If you enjoyed this review, please check out my anime review blog at trips-anime-review.tumblr.com/

Generic harem anime with some fun humor. 
If harem animes are Happy meals then this one is a happy meal with a super cool toy inside. That toy is the silly humor that the main character gets into due to that "Absolute Choice". Its the only redeeming feature in this bland burger, but it is a pretty strong redeeming factor. Aside from that, we have standard nice guy protagonist #1598 and female characters who are a set of different anime girl tropes with not much underneath except pantsu. In the end, its funny but forgettable.
Harem Development Index: 3/10 From start to end, the harem justseems like a default setting with no reasoning behind it and zero progress with any of the girls by the end.

Many of you reading will be quite familiar with anime, but for those who aren't, welcome to a new type of media with its own unique conventions. Ore no bla bla bla is a reasonably good anime, and has a little bit of everything, but falls short in so many ways.
While the philosophical intro was quite a refreshing way to start a comedy, it spent far too long developing a really superficial thesis. That said, those with background in history, particularly Japanese history, are treated to many jokes about famous people and their choices. This kind of humour is an absolute pleasure in small, unexpecteddoses, but the intro was quite hamfisted.


Throughout the anime, there were many moments that gave the writers opportunity to explore characters and the choice plot device in more depth, but I constantly found myself disappointed by their refusal to explore. The few good plot twists in the series were heavily telegraphed up to 3 or 4 episodes early, and the choice mechanic rarely served a purpose other than comic relief. 


The characters are fairly well-developed, but none of them had a significant character arc. By episode 10, even the protagonist was basically the same character we met in the first episode. While most of the plot was lackluster and dull, the charm of this anime comes from how outrageous some of the situations are. There was also quite a lot of fanservice and fetish fuel in the anime, though I'm quite neutral towards both. 


NouCome is not bad. The problem is that it isn't really that great either. The art and characters are solid. The storyline and comedy fall flat quite often. It's hard to favour this one when there are so many excellent anime in the comedy genre already.


I didn't enjoy it much, but the anime has moe appeal for those who love cute and vulnerable characters.

It's simply, basically, eminently, a funny and absurd comedy school life of a boy highschooler. First appearance as light novel on 2012 followed by manga in the next year, both writtern by Takeru Kasukabe. The animation version has 10 eps on Fall 2013 and 1 OVA released on May 2014.
    Straight to the plot! The harem story of a boy who surrounded by few ‘weird’ girls in his school, and he is known by the entire school itself for making so many fusses. The boy is suffering from a curse called “Absolute Choices”, it gives him two or more choices, he isnot permitted to not choose one of it immediately or he will suffer from the extreme pain more than just a normal headache. Often, or mostly, the funny parts come from his undeniable choice, such an abnormal choices and circumstances he has to bear no matter what. This extreme school life of a boy and few girls I can’t even imagine myself being stuck in the bunch of “freak” peeps.


    {SPOILER} To get rid of the “Absolute Choices” curse he agrees helplessly the chance God sends to him through a girl who’s falling from the sky in a random sunny day. Did I wrote ‘God’? Yeah it exactly is as you read. The ‘God’ appears normally as a minor character like in other series, but this one, this God, gets through him via cell phone. The notifications are the tasks Kanade Amakusa—the name of the boy-must do, and forbid any failure, he needs to accomplish it during the given time, otherwise Kanade will not have any chance in the future to eradicate the curse. Along with the clumsy Chocolat—the name of the falling girl from God-they try to finish every absurd tasks, perform unimaginable tasks in Kanade’s school life.



    There are not much, just few supranatural thingy, I mean like simple magic tricks, pop-up things and other simple stuffs shown in the series. The genres are comedy, school life, slice-of-life, and ecchi. I describe the ecchi-ness in this show as indicate sexual appeals from those girls, and the harem scenes appear like tons of comedy scenes. The characters surely affect the whole show since it’s about comedy, so the problems, personalities, situations, the feels, from extremely varied cast are needed to give the best comedy scenes. I might say it’s above average but not too high, yes it is funny however. As usual, the ecchi-ness sometimes bothers me, because in few scenes it feels off or they shouldn’t be there and it can be more funny w/o that way.


    The theme songs are..ummm maybe fun, and it's catchy. It's hard to describe, can't find the right words for it. By the way, the OP is sung by Afilia Saga "S・M・L☆" & the ED theme "Taiyou to Tsuki no Cross" (太陽と月のCROSS) by TWO-FORMULA (Kaori Sadohara & Saeko Zougou).



The rating I give is 5 ! You can choose this one for fun, watch it when you're bored can relieve your bad day.

Pros:

Funny, such a ridiculous story

Good graphics for school life story


Cons:

Sometimes the funny scenes feel off or too harsh

The main point here just the humour and ecchi-ness

I'll try to keep this review brief. I'll start with the negatives and end with the positives.
Overall, this series is quite generic, as the characters, their development, and interactions are very common for this whole "fan-servicey, school romance, comedy, harem" type anime. It does try to set itself apart by forcing a seemingly metaphysical concept like "Every choice in your life affects the world" down your throat in the first episode. However, the best way to watch this series is to not take it so seriously. This concept is never taken further than purely for the sake of comedy and some light romance.
As for myenjoyment; as a whole, it was fairly enjoyable. It was filled with (again, generic) situational "cringe" comedy, which is always reliable to fall back upon. In a series like this, this type of comedy fits well. The characters were also fairly likable.\n
This series is good, NOT a masterpiece, and NOT a piece of crap. Don't make the mistake of thinking there is some deep meaning to it as this will cause you to either fall in love with it for a reason that does not exist, or hate it for forcing your high expectations upon it.\n\n
Thank you for reading.

If you don't like this anime after one episode, drop it, it will not get any better for you. I struggled to finish it over the course of more than a year (I hate dropping shows once I've started watching them.) That being said, there definitely will be people who would enjoy this show so I will go into more detail.
Story: 7
The premise is an interesting one; but it felt like it could have been executed it better. Some of Amakusa's choices lead to hilarious moments.
Lots of ecchi and perverted jokes; some of which were good, but I found much of them to be tryingtoo hard.


Art: 9

Absolutely beautiful. All the main characters had lovely eyes, and cute outfits with pretty details. The backgrounds and scenery were nothing to complain about either. The quality was consistent from start to finish.


Sound: 6

The opening song was bouncy and fun, and the ending song was great.

Most of the girls sounded more like kindergartners than teenagers, which was uncomfortable considering the sexual situations in which they often found themselves. Background music is nothing worth mentioning, as I just finished the show and honestly can't even remember any of it.


Character: 5

We get the whole harem "set;" the tsunderes, well meaning airheads, lolis, girl with small boobs complex, and yes, even a clueless protagonist. It can be difficult to come up with entirely original characters, I get that, but these ones weren't developed at all during the show. There was virtually no character growth. Some of the characters did have signature gags that were amusing.


Enjoyment: 4


Overall: 4

I gave it a low rating because I didn't enjoy watching most of it. If you can't enjoy the show, then it doesn't really matter how good the rest of the qualifiers are.



If ecchi, perverted jokes, and harems are your thing, you will probably enjoy this show.

Absolute Choice is not an amazing series, but neither is it terrible- in many ways it is average, and in some ways, it almost exceeds expectations, almost. The story,sadly, is quite predictable despite the premise allowing interesting twists and turns. Although not every aspect of the story is entirely foreseeable, the general plot is easy enough to anticipate. The art is average in quality, though there was some interesting concepts and ideas that, sometimes, were represented visually in a clever manner. The op is serviceable, with a passable song. I found the voice acting quite decent at times, if slightly odd at certain intervals. Thehighlight, for me, was the individual choices that the main character, Kanade Amakusa, is  forced to make throughout the series; this added some flavor to episodes that would otherwise be uninteresting and bland.  The characters were decent, if not good- effort was made in an attempt to develop these characters. They have actual personality and and aren't just walking clichés; sometimes the characters actually make tough decisions, where it isn't entirely clear what they will do, though this doesn't mitigate the lacking story. The series, I found, was fairly enjoyable, but didn't live up to its potential, with the possibilities made viable with the somewhat unique idea.

The show had an interesting premise to start, but fell apart by halfway through.  It wasn't a normal harem at the beginning, but they kept forcing it to conform.  The early episodes had some laugh out loud moments and painful awkwardness.  So painful at times I almost stopped, but the few funny moments kept me going.  I only completed the show because after I'm halfway through a series I feel obligated to finish.
I should mention that the show had a handicap for Western audiences as there a lot of jokes and puns that clearly don't translate well or make sense.That handicap was not the reason this show failed though.  If a character didn't start bland, the show did their best make them become bland.\n\n
It's frustrating to watch an anime that has enough hidden pieces in it that you can tell there could have been something good, squander that potential.  Is it possible to try too hard to be both unique and like everything else at the same time?  I think this is anime did.

(Mini Review) 
For a comedy that's largely based on shock value, this show is quite boring. Plenty of fanservice, eccentric characters and a plot that allows for some creative comedic possibilities are all jumbled together in hopes of cohesion but feel far too disjointed to keep a decent pace. The strongest point for this show was its eccentric cast but it was very hit or miss and tended use them to sequel bait for their next season.

I liked this series because it's something different from what you usually expect from a harem based anime. What I look for in a good anime series are characters that are distinctively different from one another and have a personality that anyone who watches it, would fall in love with. I couldn't help but to hide my face when certain characters showed their unique charm while watching it. What this anime does best is not just focus on the main character but instead, put special attention all the characters (even the ones that are occasionally shown) that's in each episode. I'm not going to getinto the whole back story on what the anime is because you can easily get the general idea from the overview that the website gives. 


I was somewhat skeptical about how this anime was based on the main character suffering from "Absolute Choice". Choose one or the other. When you think of that, especially in a harem series, you would expect heartbreak 24/7 because while one character is happy, the other would be sad. This anime did not take that approach by making this series a very heart-wrenching drama where you're going to bawl your eyes out. The choices that are given to the protagonist in this anime are... very different and entertaining to witness.


This is without a doubt a series that everyone should watch.
